column2: Isolate and pronounce each sound in grade-appropriate words including those with consonant digraphs and consonant blends (e.g., what is the ending sound in finish?)

column2: Isolate and then pronounce the initial, medial, or final sound in single-syllable words including those with long vowels and consonant blends (e.g., what is the middle sound in goat?)

column2: Understand that changing or adding a letter changes a word (e.g., pick which word is made from -at when reading the words rat, rap, and run; pick which word is made when adding r to band when reading the words brand, bread, and bring; pick which word is made when adding t to the end of star when reading the words spark, start, and tears)

column2: Decode one-syllable nonsense words with a variety of common spelling patterns

column2: Explain whether facts included in an argument are used for or against an issue
